inclusion.criterion: Subject is at least 18 years old and able to give written informed consent
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Subject has received external beam radiotherapy > 4000 cGy for SCCA of the head and/or neck
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Radiation therapy was completed at least 16 weeks (4 months) prior to enrollment into the study but not greater than 52 weeks (12 months)
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Radiation included at least three of four of the major salivary glands (submandibular and parotid glands) in the initial field
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Primary therapy was designed with curative intent. Surgery is permitted if the Grade 1 or 2 xerostomia by CTC version 3.0 criteria (Appendix D)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Demonstratable salivary flow as assessed by the clinician after administration of a potent sialogogue such as lemon juice (1 teaspoon)
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Subject has at least one anatomically intact parotid gland and one submandibular gland
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: An EKG obtained has been performed in the past 6 months showing no arrhythmias or contraindication to administration of a muscarinic agent AND there has been no interval change in cardiac health
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Subject is able to eat an oral diet to maintain adequate hydration and nutrition
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Subject is English speaking and of sufficient mental capacity to comply with the study requirements
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Subject has a life expectancy less than 12 months.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Subject is known or suspected to have persistent disease after curative intent
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Subject is greater than 12 months out from completion of radiation therapy
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient has metastatic papillary thyroid cancer and has received external beam radiotherapy. However, they have a life expectancy less than 12 months due to their disease status.
